thread.title: The Crown: How did King George VI die? A look back at his life in pictures
thread.title_full: The Crown: How did King George VI die? A look back at his life in pictures

title: The Crown: How did King George VI die? A look back at his life in pictures
text:
How did King George VI die? 
The Crown opens with King George coughing up blood into a lavatory at Buckingham Palace. 
In typically British fashion, he asks a doctor whether he should be worried about “blood in his spittle”. 
Later on in the show, the King undergoes surgery in the Palace to remove a lung after he is diagnosed with cancer. GETTY / NETFLIX King George, left, is played by Jared Harris in The Crown The Crown: Netflix's new royal drama Wed, October 5, 2016 Netflix's new royal drama stars Claire Foy as the young monarch and Matt Smith as Prince Philip. The 10-part series focusses on the first days of Elizabeth's reign as Queen as well as her struggle to maintain her marriage. Play slideshow 1 of 20 Claire Foy admits she has a new respect for the Queen and Prince Phillip after staring in the series 
The medics in the show are not actors but real-life surgeons carrying out the operation on a prosthetic body. 
But despite their best efforts, shortly after the surgery George succumbed to the disease, passing the crown on to his eldest daughter Elizabeth. 
In real-life, the King died on February 6, 1952 due to a coronary thrombosis – a blockage of blood to the heart resulting from a blood clot in an artery.
